title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 20 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 20.

questions.question: Who came against Jehoshaphat to battle according to 2 Chronicles 20:1?
options: Children of Moab and Ammon
Children of Israel
Philistines
Babylonians
questions.correctAnswer: Children of Moab and Ammon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:1 states that the children of Moab and Ammon came against Jehoshaphat to battle.

questions.question: Where were the great multitude reported to be in 2 Chronicles 20:2?
options: Hazazontamar, which is Engedi
Jerusalem
Valley of Berachah
Eziongeber
questions.correctAnswer: Hazazontamar, which is Engedi
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:2 mentions that the multitude was in Hazazontamar, which is Engedi.

questions.question: What did Jehoshaphat proclaim throughout all Judah in response to the threat?
options: A fast
A feast
A battle plan
A celebration
questions.correctAnswer: A fast
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:3 shows Jehoshaphat proclaiming a fast throughout all Judah.

questions.question: Where did Jehoshaphat stand to pray before the new court as recorded in 2 Chronicles 20:5?
options: In the house of the LORD
On the city wall
In the wilderness
At the watch tower
questions.correctAnswer: In the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:5 states Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: What did Jehoshaphat ask God about in his prayer in 2 Chronicles 20:6?
options: If God rules over all kingdoms of the heathen
If God will give him riches
If God will grant him a long life
If God will destroy Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: If God rules over all kingdoms of the heathen
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:6 asks if God rules over all kingdoms of the heathen and has power and might.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 20:9, what will God do if the people stand before His house and cry in affliction?
options: Hear and help
Ignore them
Punish them
Send a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: Hear and help
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:9 states that if they cry unto God in affliction, He will hear and help.

questions.question: What did the Spirit of the LORD tell Jahaziel to say to Jehoshaphat and the people in 2 Chronicles 20:15?
options: The battle is not yours, but God's
You must fight bravely
You will lose this battle
Flee to the mountains
questions.correctAnswer: The battle is not yours, but God's
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:15 records that the Spirit told Jahaziel to say the battle belongs to God.

questions.question: What instruction was given for the battle in 2 Chronicles 20:17?
options: Stand still and see the salvation of the LORD
Charge at dawn
Hide in the wilderness
Build a strong fortress
questions.correctAnswer: Stand still and see the salvation of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:17 commands Judah to stand still and see the LORD’s salvation.

questions.question: Who stood up to praise the LORD with a loud voice on high in 2 Chronicles 20:19?
options: Levites, children of Kohathites and Korhites
Priests only
Jehoshaphat's soldiers
The people of Moab
questions.correctAnswer: Levites, children of Kohathites and Korhites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:19 states the Levites of Kohathites and Korhites praised the LORD with a loud voice.

questions.question: What was appointed to go before the army and praise the LORD in 2 Chronicles 20:21?
options: Singers
Warriors
Messengers
Priests
questions.correctAnswer: Singers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:21 shows that Jehoshaphat appointed singers to praise the LORD before the army.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 20:22, the LORD set ambushments against the enemies when the people began to sing and praise.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:22 confirms that the LORD set ambushments when they began to sing and praise.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Judah had to fight fiercely in the battle described in 2 Chronicles 20:24.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:24 describes the enemy corpses fallen with none escaping, indicating the battle was won without direct fighting by Judah.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah for twenty-five years according to 2 Chronicles 20:31.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:31 states Jehoshaphat reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Chronicles 20:20: 'Believe in the LORD your God, so shall ye be _______; believe his prophets, so shall ye prosper.'
options: established
saved
blessed
delivered
questions.correctAnswer: established
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:20 says 'Believe in the LORD your God, so shall ye be established.'

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 20:37, what happened to the ships made by Jehoshaphat and Ahaziah?
options: They were broken and could not go to Tarshish
They successfully sailed to Tarshish
They were captured by enemies
They were sold for gold
questions.correctAnswer: They were broken and could not go to Tarshish
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:37 states the ships were broken and could not go to Tarshish.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on 2 Chronicles 20, what biblical truth would you share about dealing with fear and uncertainty?
options: Trust that God is in control and will fight your battles
Rely solely on your own strength and strategy
Avoid seeking God and focus on practical solutions
Ignore the situation and hope it resolves itself
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God is in control and will fight your battles
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat was afraid but sought the LORD and was told by the Spirit not to fear because the battle is God's (2 Chronicles 20:3, 20:15-17). This shows the importance of trusting God rather than relying only on ourselves.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 teach us about the importance of corporate prayer and fasting in times of crisis?
options: Jehoshaphat proclaimed a fast and Judah gathered to seek the LORD together
Individuals prayed silently without involving the community
They ignored the threat and did not pray
They only sent soldiers to fight without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat proclaimed a fast and Judah gathered to seek the LORD together
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat called for a fast throughout Judah, and all Judah gathered to ask help of the LORD (2 Chronicles 20:3-4). This emphasizes the power of united prayer and fasting in seeking God's help.

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by a large problem. According to 2 Chronicles 20, what attitude should they adopt regarding God's power and sovereignty?
options: Recognize God's power and that no one can withstand Him
Feel hopeless because the problem is too big
Try to handle everything without God's help
Doubt God's ability to intervene
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize God's power and that no one can withstand Him
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat acknowledged God's supreme power ruling over all kingdoms and that none can withstand Him (2 Chronicles 20:6). This encourages believers to trust in God's sovereignty amid trials.

questions.question: In 2 Chronicles 20, what example is given to show how the people should respond when facing overwhelming odds?
options: Stand still, trust the LORD, and see His salvation
Run away from the battle
Fight with all their might without trusting God
Make alliances with enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Stand still, trust the LORD, and see His salvation
questions.explanation: God instructed them not to fight but to stand still and see the salvation of the LORD (2 Chronicles 20:17). This teaches reliance on God's deliverance rather than human effort alone.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 illustrate the role of worship in spiritual warfare?
options: Jehoshaphat appointed singers to praise the LORD before the battle
They focused only on weapons and ignored worship
Worship was done after the battle only
Worship was discouraged during warfare
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat appointed singers to praise the LORD before the battle
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat appointed singers to praise God as they went out to battle (2 Chronicles 20:21), and as they praised, God set ambushments against their enemies (2 Chronicles 20:22). This shows worship as a powerful weapon.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 20 teach about humility and dependence on God when facing enemies or challenges?
options: Jehoshaphat bowed his head and worshiped before the LORD
He boasted about his army's strength
He ignored God and relied on alliances
He acted independently without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat bowed his head and worshiped before the LORD
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat humbled himself by bowing his head and worshiping God (2 Chronicles 20:18), showing the importance of humility and dependence on God in trials.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 20, the battle was won because Judah's army fought fiercely and defeated the enemies by their own strength.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The battle was won because God set ambushments against the enemies while Judah praised God and did not fight themselves (2 Chronicles 20:22-23). The victory was God's, not Judah's own strength.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 teach us about trusting God's timing and provision in times of need?
options: They spent three days gathering abundant spoil after the victory
They immediately rushed to take spoil before the battle ended
They doubted God and hurried to fight
They left the spoil for others to take
questions.correctAnswer: They spent three days gathering abundant spoil after the victory
questions.explanation: The people gathered spoil for three days because there was so much (2 Chronicles 20:25), illustrating God's abundant provision in His timing.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with doubt after seeing their enemy's strength. Based on 2 Chronicles 20, what encouragement would you share about focusing on God during trials?
options: Keep your eyes on God because He will guide and help you
Focus only on the enemy's weakness
Ignore God and rely on your own plans
Avoid praying and wait passively
questions.correctAnswer: Keep your eyes on God because He will guide and help you
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat prayed that their eyes be upon God since they did not know what to do, trusting that God would help (2 Chronicles 20:12). This teaches reliance on God in uncertainty.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 show the importance of faith in God’s prophets and His Word?
options: Jehoshaphat urged the people to believe in the LORD and His prophets for success
The people ignored the prophets and acted on their own
Jehoshaphat doubted the prophet's word
They relied on foreign advice instead
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat urged the people to believe in the LORD and His prophets for success
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat told the people to believe in God and His prophets so they would be established and prosper (2 Chronicles 20:20). This highlights trusting God's Word through His messengers.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 20, Jehoshaphat's reign was marked by peace because God gave him rest from all his enemies.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet because God gave him rest round about (2 Chronicles 20:30), indicating God's blessing of peace during his reign.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 20 teach about the danger of ungodly alliances in a believer's life?
options: Jehoshaphat's alliance with Ahaziah led to the breaking of his works
All alliances are good and beneficial
Jehoshaphat's alliances were always blessed
The chapter does not mention alliances
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat's alliance with Ahaziah led to the breaking of his works
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat joined with Ahaziah who did wickedly, and as a result, the LORD broke his works and his ships were destroyed (2 Chronicles 20:35-37). This warns about ungodly partnerships.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 encourage believers to express gratitude and worship after experiencing God's deliverance?
options: They assembled in the valley to bless the LORD and praised with instruments
They ignored worship and focused on rebuilding
They blamed others for their troubles
They stopped praising after the battle
questions.correctAnswer: They assembled in the valley to bless the LORD and praised with instruments
questions.explanation: After the victory, they gathered in the valley of Berachah to bless the LORD and returned to Jerusalem with psalteries, harps, and trumpets (2 Chronicles 20:26, 28), demonstrating gratitude through worship.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear about future uncertainties. Based on 2 Chronicles 20, what practical step would you recommend?
options: Set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of the LORD
Run away from the problem
Ignore the situation
Plan everything without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of the LORD
questions.explanation: God told Judah to stand still and see the salvation of the LORD, encouraging calm trust instead of fear (2 Chronicles 20:17). This shows the importance of faith and patience.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 20 illustrate the role of leadership in guiding God’s people through spiritual challenges?
options: Jehoshaphat led by seeking God, encouraging faith, and appointing worship leaders
The king ignored God and led the people into battle alone
Jehoshaphat depended entirely on advisors without prayer
The people acted without any leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat led by seeking God, encouraging faith, and appointing worship leaders
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sought God, proclaimed a fast, encouraged belief in God and His prophets, and appointed singers to praise God before battle (2 Chronicles 20:3-4, 20, 21), showing godly leadership.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 20.

questions.question: Which groups came against Jehoshaphat to battle as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 20?
options: Children of Moab, Ammon, and mount Seir
Children of Edom and Philistines
Children of Ammon and Egypt
Children of Moab, Ammon, and Syria
questions.correctAnswer: Children of Moab, Ammon, and mount Seir
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:1-10 specifically mention the children of Moab, Ammon, and mount Seir coming against Jehoshaphat.

questions.question: What was Jehoshaphat's initial response when he heard about the great multitude coming against him?
options: He sought the LORD and proclaimed a fast
He immediately gathered an army to fight
He fled to another city
He sent diplomats to negotiate peace
questions.correctAnswer: He sought the LORD and proclaimed a fast
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 20:3, Jehoshaphat feared and set himself to seek the LORD, proclaiming a fast throughout Judah.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the LORD, before the __________.
options: new court
holy altar
king's chamber
outer gates
questions.correctAnswer: new court
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:5 states Jehoshaphat stood before the new court in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: In Jehoshaphat's prayer, which attribute of God is emphasized to affirm His sovereignty over the kingdoms?
options: Power and might in His hand
His mercy and forgiveness
His patience and long-suffering
His wrath and judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Power and might in His hand
questions.explanation: Verse 6 highlights God's power and might in His hand, stating that none is able to withstand Him.

questions.question: What condition does Jehoshaphat mention that would prompt God to hear and help them?
options: If they stand before the house and cry unto God in affliction
If they offer sacrifices daily
If they build more altars for God
If they fast for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: If they stand before the house and cry unto God in affliction
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:9 describes that when evil comes and they stand before the house and cry to God, He will hear and help.

questions.question: Who was Jahaziel, upon whom the Spirit of the LORD came, and what was his role?
options: A Levite of the sons of Asaph who prophesied peace and victory
A priest who led sacrifices for the people
A military commander who planned the battle strategy
A scribe who recorded the events
questions.correctAnswer: A Levite of the sons of Asaph who prophesied peace and victory
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:14-15 identifies Jahaziel as a Levite of Asaph's line, upon whom the Spirit of the LORD came and gave a prophetic message.

questions.question: What key message did Jahaziel deliver to Jehoshaphat and the people regarding the upcoming battle?
options: The battle is not yours, but God's; do not be afraid or dismayed
You must fight fiercely to win this battle
Send ambassadors to negotiate peace
Flee and hide until the enemies pass
questions.correctAnswer: The battle is not yours, but God's; do not be afraid or dismayed
questions.explanation: Verses 15-17 emphasize that the battle belongs to God and that the people should not fear or fight but stand still and see God's salvation.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat and the people were instructed to actively engage in battle and fight with their weapons.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:17 says they would not need to fight but to stand still and see the salvation of the LORD.

questions.question: What role did the Levites of the Kohathites and Korhites play in the battle?
options: They praised the LORD with a loud voice
They led the army into battle
They arranged the military formations
They prepared the weapons for the soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: They praised the LORD with a loud voice
questions.explanation: Verse 19 states that these Levites stood up to praise the LORD God of Israel with a loud voice on high.

questions.question: What strategy did Jehoshaphat employ involving singers as the army went out for battle?
options: He appointed singers to praise the beauty of holiness before the army
He silenced all music to maintain focus
He sent singers to distract the enemy
He used singers to send coded messages
questions.correctAnswer: He appointed singers to praise the beauty of holiness before the army
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:21 describes how Jehoshaphat appointed singers to praise the LORD as they went before the army.

questions.question: How did the LORD intervene against the enemies when the singers began to praise Him?
options: The LORD set ambushments against the enemies, causing them to be smitten
The LORD sent a great storm to scatter them
The LORD caused the enemy leaders to quarrel among themselves
The LORD blinded the enemy soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD set ambushments against the enemies, causing them to be smitten
questions.explanation: Verse 22 states that when the singers praised the LORD, He set ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, and they were defeated.

questions.question: What was the outcome when the enemies of Judah turned on each other?
options: They destroyed one another completely
They formed an alliance against Judah
They retreated without fighting
They negotiated a truce
questions.correctAnswer: They destroyed one another completely
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:23 explains that the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against mount Seir and destroyed them, then each helped destroy the other.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Valley of Berachah mentioned in 2 Chronicles 20?
options: It is where they assembled to bless the LORD after the battle
It is where the army first camped before battle
It is the place where Jehoshaphat made a covenant
It is the location of the enemy's main fortress
questions.correctAnswer: It is where they assembled to bless the LORD after the battle
questions.explanation: Verse 26 notes that on the fourth day, they assembled in the valley of Berachah to bless the LORD, hence the name meaning 'valley of blessing'.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 20, how did Jehoshaphat's reign end with regard to peace and rest?
options: His realm was quiet because God gave him rest round about
He was constantly at war with neighboring nations
He was exiled from Jerusalem
He lost control of the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: His realm was quiet because God gave him rest round about
questions.explanation: Verse 30 states that Jehoshaphat's realm was quiet because his God gave him rest all around him.

questions.question: What was the consequence of Jehoshaphat's alliance with Ahaziah king of Israel?
options: The LORD broke his works and the ships were destroyed
He gained great wealth and expanded his kingdom
He defeated all his enemies successfully
He built a temple together with Ahaziah
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD broke his works and the ships were destroyed
questions.explanation: Verses 35-37 describe how Jehoshaphat joined Ahaziah to make ships, but the LORD broke his works and the ships were broken.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 20 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Which nations came against Jehoshaphat to battle as described in 2 Chronicles 20?
options: Moab, Ammon, and others beside the Ammonites
Egypt, Assyria, and Babylon
Philistines and Edomites
Babylonians and Persians
questions.correctAnswer: Moab, Ammon, and others beside the Ammonites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:1 states that the children of Moab, Ammon, and others beside the Ammonites came against Jehoshaphat. This shows the political opposition Israel faced, consistent with God's people often being besieged by hostile nations (cf. Exodus 17:8-13; Judges 6:33-35; Jeremiah 25:9).

questions.question: What was Jehoshaphat's initial response when he heard about the great multitude coming against him?
options: He feared and sought the LORD, proclaiming a fast throughout Judah
He immediately gathered an army to fight
He fled to the mountains
He made an alliance with the enemy
questions.correctAnswer: He feared and sought the LORD, proclaiming a fast throughout Judah
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows Jehoshaphat feared and set himself to seek the LORD and proclaimed a fast. This reveals the biblical theme that godly leaders rely on prayer and fasting rather than merely human strength (cf. Ezra 8:21-23; Nehemiah 1:4; Acts 13:2-3).

questions.question: In his prayer, what attribute of God does Jehoshaphat emphasize about God's sovereignty over nations?
options: God rules over all kingdoms of the heathen with power and might
God is limited by earthly powers
God only rules Israel
God is distant from the affairs of nations
questions.correctAnswer: God rules over all kingdoms of the heathen with power and might
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat acknowledges God's universal sovereignty and omnipotence (v. 6). This is a core biblical doctrine, echoed in Psalm 22:28, Daniel 4:17, and Romans 13:1, affirming God’s control over all earthly governments.

questions.question: According to Jehoshaphat's prayer, why did God not allow Israel to invade the territories of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir?
options: Because God had not given them possession of these lands
Because these nations were chosen by God
Because Israel was too weak
Because they were allies of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Because God had not given them possession of these lands
questions.explanation: Verse 10 explains God would not let Israel invade those lands when they came out of Egypt. This highlights God's providential ordering of land inheritance, consistent with Deuteronomy 2:4-5 and His covenantal promises regarding the land.

questions.question: What does Jehoshaphat declare about the battle in his reassurance from the Spirit of the LORD through Jahaziel?
options: The battle is not yours, but God's
You must fight hard to win
God will remain silent in this battle
You need to form alliances to win
questions.correctAnswer: The battle is not yours, but God's
questions.explanation: Verse 15 records the Spirit of the LORD saying the battle belongs to God, not man. This teaches divine sovereignty in salvation and deliverance, paralleling Exodus 14:14, Deuteronomy 20:4, and Romans 8:31 where God fights for His people.

questions.question: How does the Spirit of the LORD instruct Judah to conduct themselves in the coming battle?
options: To stand still and see the salvation of the LORD
To charge immediately with weapons
To hide and wait for reinforcements
To negotiate peace with the enemy
questions.correctAnswer: To stand still and see the salvation of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 17 instructs Judah to not fight but stand still and witness God's salvation. This reflects trust in God’s deliverance, echoing Psalm 46:10 and Isaiah 30:15, emphasizing faith and patience in God's timing.

questions.question: What role did the Levites of the Kohathites and Korhites play in the battle against the Ammonites and Moabites?
options: They stood up to praise the LORD with a loud voice
They led the charge in battle
They stayed behind to guard the city
They acted as negotiators with the enemy
questions.correctAnswer: They stood up to praise the LORD with a loud voice
questions.explanation: Verse 19 shows the Levites praising God, which illustrates the biblical principle that worship and praise are powerful spiritual weapons (cf. 1 Samuel 16:23; Psalm 149:6-9; Ephesians 5:19).

questions.question: What significant action did Jehoshaphat take before going out to face the enemy in the morning?
options: He appointed singers to praise the LORD as they went before the army
He armed all the people with new weapons
He sent spies ahead of the army
He fasted alone in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He appointed singers to praise the LORD as they went before the army
questions.explanation: Verse 21 describes Jehoshaphat appointing singers to lead the army in praise, highlighting worship as integral to spiritual warfare, consistent with Exodus 15:20-21 and Psalm 68:24-25.

questions.question: What was the outcome when the people began to sing and praise the LORD?
options: The LORD set ambushments against their enemies, who were smitten
The enemy surrendered immediately
The armies joined forces
There was no immediate change
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD set ambushments against their enemies, who were smitten
questions.explanation: Verse 22 tells that as they praised, God caused confusion among the enemy, leading to their defeat. This demonstrates God’s power to deliver His people supernaturally (cf. Exodus 14:24; Judges 7:22; 2 Kings 7:6).

questions.question: How long did Judah take to gather the spoil from their enemies, and what does this indicate?
options: Three days; the spoil was so abundant they couldn't carry it all at once
One day; the spoil was minimal
Seven days; they celebrated victory
They took no spoil, dedicating everything to God
questions.correctAnswer: Three days; the spoil was so abundant they couldn't carry it all at once
questions.explanation: Verse 25 reveals that the spoil was so great it took three days to gather, indicating God's generous provision and blessing after victory (cf. Joshua 6:21; 1 Samuel 30:18-20).

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name of the place where Judah assembled to bless the LORD after the battle?
options: Valley of Berachah, meaning 'Valley of Blessing'
Valley of Dry Bones, meaning 'Restoration'
Valley of Victory, meaning 'Conquest'
Valley of Peace, meaning 'Reconciliation'
questions.correctAnswer: Valley of Berachah, meaning 'Valley of Blessing'
questions.explanation: Verse 26 states that they blessed the LORD in the valley called Berachah, which means blessing. This is symbolic of thanksgiving and God's faithfulness after deliverance (cf. Psalm 67:7; Genesis 12:2-3; Deuteronomy 28:3-6).

questions.question: How did the fear of God affect the surrounding kingdoms after the LORD fought for Israel?
options: They were afraid of Israel because the LORD fought against their enemies
They formed alliances to attack Israel
They ignored Israel's victory
They mocked Israel's God
questions.correctAnswer: They were afraid of Israel because the LORD fought against their enemies
questions.explanation: Verse 29 explains that fear of God came upon all kingdoms upon hearing of God's intervention. This aligns with the biblical theme that God's acts inspire reverence and fear (cf. Exodus 15:14-16; Psalm 96:9; Isaiah 8:13).

questions.question: What was the spiritual condition of the people regarding the high places during Jehoshaphat's reign?
options: The high places were not taken away because the people had not prepared their hearts to God
All high places were destroyed immediately
The high places were converted into synagogues
The high places were used only for worship of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The high places were not taken away because the people had not prepared their hearts to God
questions.explanation: Verse 33 notes that high places remained because the people's hearts were not fully prepared to God. This reveals the ongoing struggle with idolatry and incomplete spiritual reform (cf. 1 Kings 3:2-4; 2 Kings 23:5; Jeremiah 3:2).

questions.question: What was the consequence of Jehoshaphat's alliance with Ahaziah king of Israel?
options: The LORD broke his works and the ships were broken
The alliance resulted in great military victories
They successfully established trade with Tarshish
Jehoshaphat became king of Israel too
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD broke his works and the ships were broken
questions.explanation: Verses 35-37 describe how Jehoshaphat's alliance with the wicked Ahaziah led to the LORD breaking his works, including the shipbuilding project. This illustrates divine judgment against ungodly partnerships (cf. 2 Corinthians 6:14-18; Proverbs 13:20; Exodus 34:12-16).

questions.question: Who was the prophet that came upon by the Spirit of the LORD to deliver a message of reassurance to Jehoshaphat and the people?
options: Jahaziel, a Levite of the sons of Asaph
Elisha, the prophet of Israel
Nathan, the prophet to David
Micaiah, the son of Imlah
questions.correctAnswer: Jahaziel, a Levite of the sons of Asaph
questions.explanation: Verse 14 identifies Jahaziel, a Levite, as the one filled with the Spirit to speak God's word. This highlights the role of Spirit-inspired prophecy in guiding God's people (cf. Numbers 11:25; 1 Samuel 10:10; Acts 2:17-18).
